column4: How do I determine if the system is using dma?  Also, how do I set the system to use dma?
howdy!
I'm using kubuntu, kde 4.1.x now.  I just couldn't get debian working.
roger that. what exactly couldn't you get working in debian tho?

Wifi, sound (got that taken care of, but alsa appears to be working fine in 8.10 here, and I don't have the dns problems I did.  Don't know what's different.  Although kde 4.1 is laggy on the desktop.  I have to wait an average of five to ten seconds to be able to work within gadgets, like the desktop gadget.  It's not right, not when I'm using the nvidia proprietary driver and have
roger. glad to hear the things that are pretty important are working good for you now :-)

They are, but I want to install kde 3.x, alongside kde 4.1.x.  4.1 is still buggy, and I want a bloody Nvidia driver that doesn't slow up my system.  This system is flawless on Vista 64 HP, and there's no reason it shouldn't be fast on the screen eye candy, just no reason.

Incidentally, do you know what the hdparm command is for turning on dma?  I suppose it's being used already, but I just want to be sure.  Also, do you--or anyone else for that matter--know if 2.6.27 kernels can use E-SATA settings on the hard drive to speed up things?

well, you can expect linux to perhaps lag a little behind ms when it comes to eye candy stuff. there is definitely eye candy to be had and high powered desktop environments are getting better in linux, but it's never been linux's strong point, at least not yet
Yeah, I'm finding that out.  I'm actually thinking about doing something compleatly different ;) when it comes in the mail.
oh?
I sent away for a current copy of Open Solaris 2008.11
oh, interesting. i knew you were thinking about getting that as you mentioned before

Well, I have an old copy of Solaris 10 I got in 2006.  It wasn't 'open Solaris' then, although it was free.  It's a different way of doing *nix, and the partitioning is a bit different, too.  I don't know if it will win me over or not.  It's probably a bit like BSD.
roger.. gl with it! hope you like it too.
Back.  Had to do a recovery, and now I'm on the old nvidia driver.  Works much faster now ;)
oh, roger that. a recovery? a full recovery of your install?
anyway, glad to hear it's much faster now!

no, just booted via kubuntu recovery mode.  Very nice setup.  Got a nice ncurses menu that let me to an fsck, attempt repair at x server, and repair packages.  Nice setup.  I'm sticking with the x driver for this thing.  Proprietary is nice, but is slow.  I may need a commercial x solution (or Wayland if it ever gets off the ground) to be able to use this system completely.
I'm not doing 3D work anyway, so whatevah works.
roger that my man
hello! how you doing buddy? ever get Solaris going?
Hey bud! :) Well, I've gotten 2008.11 in the mail, and it boots nicely.  Doesn't recognize my wifi apparatus, though.  It's a staunch learning curve, and will take some time.
Let's take this to ubuntu-offtopic
roger that.. i wasn't necessarily wanting detail about it, but i will go there in case you are wanting to talk about it
I'm also helping someone with a sound issue.  I should be here for a bit, but will be available for some time to come ;)  Wifey's out and about with 'er mom, so I'm free.
roger
Heya bud! :)
hi man
When you get a sec, I'd like to run a question by ya.
ok, what is it?

I've had to recent problems happen to me, both identical in the end result, but involving the same thing:  I try to copy an audio cd, then burn it to another cd.   When I put in the second cd, close the drawer, the system suddenly won't recognize the drive.  I can't eject, and no software I use can see the dvd drive anymore.
I have to reboot to get control of the dvd drive back
Get this just now!  I put a cd-rw in my drive, go to bring up k3b, and the entire K-Menu, Applications menu is blank.
nm, it was scrolled down too far
I'm going to reboot and try something...I'll brb

i don't know that i can help with that. kernel 2.6.27? have you checked in /var/log/messages about this? i had problems with kernel 2.6.27 myself when it comes to my dvd drive. when trying to install from burned lived cd .iso, i would get kernel error message --> end_request: Buffer I/O in sector xxxx. i checked the md5sum, it was ok. re-downloaded the .iso anyway. re-burned several times, low speed the last few times,
Heya :)
howdy! how ya doing?
roger... hehe. live and let learn
wb, why are you so quiet? :-)
chatting with people in kde-cafe, and working on learning about documents in kde
roger that
heya, long time no see
howdy~! roger... long time
I'm downloading 10.04 64 bit.  Anything exceptionally different from Karmic?
i didn't run Karmic... been gone a long time. don't know
Ah, I see.
so you're running Karmic right now?
you using gnome or kde? let me guess.. kde! :-)
Ah, the joy of 'net drop
And yes, I *am* using kde ;) hee
ahh, i was wondering why you weren't responding
local restaurant connection...likes to hiccup now and again
i see
So what've you been up to?
working.. taking care of my rental houses. but this is offtopic. we should really talk in ubuntu-offtopic or via pm
ah, you're right of course.  Soryr.
Greetings, good friend :-).  How are you today?
good thanks. how are you doing?
I am contemplating upgrading Karmic to Lucid, and I am fielding questions.
ahh, roger
Otherwise, in need of work.    (We can also take other talk to offtopic if you desire.)
Heya.
hello
how are you trying to start kde now that you have the kde-4.4.4 ppa installed?
from gdm's login screen
have you tried using kdm?
how do I switch from gdm to kdm?
not sure if this is correct...  sudo update-alternatives --config x-session-manager
just checking, but when using gdm, are you selecting kde as the session? it should be an option down at the bottom of the gdm screen
That's what I was originally doing, but I remembered what to do:  sudo dpkg-reconfigure kdm
ahh, cool
Same for if you want to use gdm.  A screen comes up that allows you to select which display manager you want.
roger. sounds good
roger
Nice to do this once a while, if only to remember what tools to use.  I need to take more notes.  Sheesh! ;)
i have a 'commands' file and 'Notes' file i keep :)
I tried to start kde via the xterm selection in kdm.  It's a mismatch with the nvidia drivers.
i'm not real sure what to make of that. what's the exact error message
I'll have to get it again...brb
you might need to purge the nvidia driver, then install it fresh. not sure
back
I'll use pastebin
roger that. sounds good
you might need to purge the nvidia driver, then install it fresh. not sure
Got your last lines.  Here's the output error: http://paste.ubuntu.com/444209/
yeah. try, puring the nvidia driver. reboot. install it fresh, then reboot again
I'm rebooting so much the soles of my shoes will need replacing ;)
i hear ya. been there done that. i know how it is
i have to go for about one hour. i'll be back. i wish you luck!
I'm back, and having a bit of a problem.
I'm not able to even get a command prompt to come up now. I try to boot normally, or in recovery mode, and nothing comes up.  I"m in live cd now
I'm going to save to another disk and reinstall.  I want the 64bit version anyway
Greetings...back, and with a plan.
